meanings.definition: To insert or embed (something) into a part of the body
meanings.sent1: The dentist will implant the new tooth into your gums.
meanings.sent2: The surgeon will implant the pacemaker in your chest during the operation.
meanings.sent3: I wonder if they can implant a GPS tracker in my pet fish.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to implant themselves in my memory like seeds in soil.
meanings.sent5: The idea of going on a vacation to a tropical island implanted itself in my mind.

meanings.definition: To establish or settle (an idea or feeling) firmly in a person's mind or consciousness.
meanings.sent1: The teacher tried to implant the importance of reading in her students.
meanings.sent2: The advertisement aimed to implant the brand's logo in the viewers' minds.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally implanted the wrong password in my brain and now I can't remember the correct one.
meanings.sent4: His words were like seeds that implanted doubt in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The traumatic experience implanted a fear of heights in her consciousness.
